CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 9, 1941, pg. 3, reads: "James Weldon Johnson Camp Model Project - Camp James Weldon Johnson, At Beautiful Raccoon Creek, Affords New Phase of Life For Youngsters. Above are scenes from Camp James Weldon Johnson, situated on Raccoon Creek in foothills of the beautiful Allegehney [Allegheny] mountains just 34 miles from Pittsburg [Pittsburgh].  Some of the children who enjoyed the facilities of the spacious grounds during the past two weeks are pictured... Insert: Three able and efficient life guards of Camp Johnson waterfront, left to right: William Phillips, Sewickley, Pa.; Emma J. Coy, Pittsburgh, Pa.; and Clarence L. Robinson, Pittsburgh.  This trio is composed of some of the foremost aquatic stars in this section..."
TitMainTitle: William Phillips, Emma J. Coy, and Clarence L. Robinson, standing in front lifeguard tower at Camp Weldon Johnson, Beaver County, Pennsylvania
